text: Sir Anthony James Leggett (born 26 March 1938) is a British theoretical physicist. He is a professor emeritus at the University of Illinois at Urbana- Champaign. Leggett is known for his theory of low-temperature physics. He won the 2003 Nobel Prize in Physics. ==References== Category:1938 births Category:Living people Category:British Nobel Prize winners Category:British physicists Category:Scientists from London Category:People from Camberwell
title: Anthony James Leggett
